hivModel:
Table of Compartments
Index, Primary Name, Secondary Name, Description, Stratified By
0, Susceptible, -, Susceptible individuals, Sexual Behavior (Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men)
1, Infectious, Untreated Infected, Untreated infected individuals, Sexual Behavior (Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men)
2, Treated, with ART, Individuals treated with antiretrovirals, Sexual Behavior (Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men)
3, Infectious, living with AIDS, People living with AIDS, Sexual Behavior (Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men)
4, HIV Deaths, -, Deaths from HIV/AIDS, Sexual Behavior (Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men)

Table of Flows with Variables
From -> To, Description, Rate Expression / Parameter, Stratum-Specific Rates
S -> I, Transmission from infected homosexual men (ContactFlow), λ_hh * S, Homosexual Men: λ_hh | Women: λ_hw | Heterosexual Men: λ_hm
S -> I, Transmission from infected women (ContactFlow), λ_w * S, Homosexual Men: 0 | Women: λ_wm | Heterosexual Men: λ_wm
S -> I, Transmission from infected heterosexual men (ContactFlow), λ_m * S, Homosexual Men: 0 | Women: λ_mw | Heterosexual Men: 0
I -> T, Initial treatment of infected individuals, α * p * I, All strata: α * p
I -> A, Progression to AIDS for untreated, α * (1-p) * I, All strata: α * (1-p)
T -> A, Progression to AIDS for treated (treatment failure), δ * T, All strata: δ
A -> D, Death from AIDS, d * A, All strata: d
∅ -> S, Recruitment of susceptible individuals, Ψ * proportion, Homosexual Men: Ψ*θ*(1-γ) | Women: Ψ*(1-θ) | Heterosexual Men: Ψ*θ*γ
All -> death, Natural mortality, μ * Compartment, All compartments and strata: μ

Table of Parameters & Values
Parameter, Meaning, Value
Ψ, Recruitment rate into the susceptible population, 333
θ, Proportion of men in the population, 0.48
γ, Proportion of heterosexual men among all men, 0.92
p, Proportion of infected individuals who receive initial treatment, 0.90
μ, Natural mortality rate, 0.0129
d, AIDS-induced mortality rate, 0.3333
δ, Rate of AIDS development in treated individuals, 0.018
α, Departure rate from infected compartments, 0.3333
β_s, Probability of heterosexual transmission per contact, 0.02
β_h, Probability of homosexual transmission per contact, 0.44
β_hw, Probability of transmission from homosexual men to women per contact, 0.018
β_hm, Probability of transmission from homosexual men to heterosexual men per contact, 0.005
c_h, Contact rate for homosexual men, 7
c_s, Contact rate for heterosexuals, 4
c_hw, Contact rate between homosexual men and women, 2
c_hm, Contact rate between homosexual and heterosexual men, 1

Calculated Force of Infection Parameters (λ)
These are pre-computed from the transmission probabilities, contact rates, and population sizes.
Parameter, Formula, Value
λ_hh, β_h * c_h * I_h / N_h, 0.09636435643564358
λ_hw, β_hw * c_hw * I_h / N_h, 0.0011263366336633665
λ_hm, β_hm * c_hm * I_h / N_h, 0.007821782178217822
λ_wm, β_s * c_s * I_w / N_w, 2.526315789473684E-6
λ_mw, β_s * c_s * I_m / N_m, 1.355124355907057E-5

Population Sizes (for reference)
N_h, Total homosexual men, 2525 (S_h + I_h = 2446 + 79)
N_w, Total women, 190000 (S_w + I_w = 189994 + 6)
N_m, Total heterosexual men, 171202 (S_m + I_m = 171173 + 29)
N, Total population, 363727

Initial Populations
Compartment, Stratum, Initial Value
S, Homosexual Men, 2446
S, Women, 189994
S, Heterosexual Men, 171173
I, Homosexual Men, 79
I, Women, 6
I, Heterosexual Men, 29
T, Homosexual Men, 36
T, Women, 48
T, Heterosexual Men, 23
A, Homosexual Men, 16
A, Women, 21
A, Heterosexual Men, 10
D, All strata, 0

Stratification Structure
Group Name, Values
SexualBehavior, Homosexual Men | Women | Heterosexual Men

Products
Product Name, Description, Groups Used
SexualBehaviorProduct, Stratification by sexual behavior, SexualBehavior

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR MODEL GENERATION:
1. All compartments EXCEPT 'HIV Deaths' should be stratified by SexualBehaviorProduct
2. Transmission flows (S -> I) are ContactFlows with contactCompartment pointing to the infected compartment
3. Each transmission route has stratum-specific rates (see Stratum-Specific Rates column)
4. Non-transmission flows (treatment, progression) use RateFlows with same rate across all strata
5. Birth sources and death sinks must be stratum-specific
6. AIDS deaths (A -> D) flow to the HIV Deaths compartment, not to death sinks
7. The λ values are PRE-CALCULATED - do not attempt to recalculate them from β, c, I, N
8. N_h, N_w, N_m represent TOTAL population in each stratum at t=0. For dynamic models, these should be recalculated as (S + I + T + A) for each stratum at each timestep. Current values are static initialization only.
covidModel:
Table of Compartments
Index, Primary Name, Description
1, S, Susceptible individuals
2, E, Exposed individuals (incubating)
3, E_q, Exposed individuals in quarantine
4, I_p, Infectious presymptomatic individuals
5, I_p_iso, Infectious presymptomatic individuals (isolated)
6, I_m, Infectious mild to moderate symptoms
7, I_m_iso, Infectious mild to moderate symptoms (isolated)
8, I_s, Infectious severe symptoms
9, I_s_iso, Infectious severe symptoms (isolated)
10, I_iso, Isolated detected cases
11, H_pre, Admitted to hospital (pre-ICU)
12, ICU, Individuals in Intensive Care Unit
13, H_post, Admitted to hospital (post-ICU)
14, R, Recovered individuals
15, D, Dead individuals

Table of Flows with Variables
From -> To, Description, Rate Expression / Parameter
S -> E, Infection of susceptible individuals, beta * S * (I_p + I_m + I_s + I_p_iso + I_m_iso + I_s_iso) / N
E -> E_q, Quarantine of exposed individuals, q * E
E -> I_p, Progression to presymptomatic, (1-q) * sigma * E
E_q -> I_p_iso, Progression of quarantined to isolated, sigma_q * E_q
I_p -> I_m, Development of mild symptoms, gamma_p * (1 - p_severe) * I_p
I_p -> I_s, Development of severe symptoms, gamma_p * p_severe * I_p
I_p_iso -> I_m_iso, Development of mild symptoms (isolated), gamma_p * (1 - p_severe) * I_p_iso
I_p_iso -> I_s_iso, Development of severe symptoms (isolated), gamma_p * p_severe * I_p_iso
I_m -> I_iso, Detection and isolation of mild cases, alpha_m * I_m
I_m -> R, Recovery of mild cases, gamma_m * I_m
I_m_iso -> I_iso, Transfer to central isolation, alpha_iso * I_m_iso
I_s -> H_pre, Hospitalization of severe cases, gamma_s * I_s
I_s_iso -> H_pre, Hospitalization of isolated severe cases, gamma_s * I_s_iso
I_iso -> R, Recovery from isolation, gamma_iso * I_iso
H_pre -> R, Recovery from hospital (pre-ICU), gamma_h_r * H_pre
H_pre -> ICU, Admission to ICU, gamma_h_icu * H_pre
ICU -> H_post, Improvement moving to post-ICU, gamma_icu_post * ICU
ICU -> D, Death from COVID in ICU, mu_icu * ICU
H_post -> R, Recovery from hospital (post-ICU), gamma_post * H_post

Table of Parameters & Values
Parameter, Meaning, Value
beta, Transmission rate (Base contact rate), 0.00001
q, Quarantine rate for exposed (Assumed low as base model has direct flow), 0.0
sigma, Incubation rate (progression to infectious), 0.4
sigma_q, Incubation rate for quarantined, 0.4
gamma_p, Rate of symptom onset (1/presymptomatic period), 1.0
p_severe, Probability of developing severe symptoms (derived from 0.15 flow), 0.15
gamma_m, Recovery rate for mild cases, 0.167
alpha_m, Isolation rate for mild cases, 0.5
gamma_s, Hospitalization rate for severe cases, 0.167
alpha_iso, Rate of movement to isolated state, 0.0
gamma_iso, Recovery rate from isolation, 0.167
gamma_h_r, Recovery rate from pre-ICU, 0.74
gamma_h_icu, Progression rate to ICU, 0.26
gamma_icu_post, Improvement rate ICU to post-ICU, 0.6
mu_icu, Mortality rate in ICU, 0.4
gamma_post, Recovery rate post-ICU, 0.048
N, Total Population (dynamic calculation), SUM(all living compartments excluding D) = 14800000 (initial)

Initial Populations
S(0) = 14700000
E(0) = 5000
E_q(0) = 1000
I_p(0) = 3000
I_p_iso(0) = 1000
I_m(0) = 8000
I_m_iso(0) = 4000
I_s(0) = 2000
I_s_iso(0) = 800
I_iso(0) = 6000
H_pre(0) = 1500
ICU(0) = 400
H_post(0) = 200
R(0) = 50000
D(0) = 100
simpleModel:
Table of Compartments
Index, Primary Name, Description
0, S, Susceptible individuals
1, E, Exposed individuals (latent)
2, I, Infectious individuals
3, R, Recovered individuals

Table of Flows with Variables
From -> To, Description, Rate Expression / Parameter
S -> E, Infection of susceptible individuals, beta * S * I / N
E -> I, Progression from latent to infectious, sigma * E
I -> R, Recovery from infection, gamma * I
R -> S, Loss of immunity (return to susceptible), omega * R
∅ -> S, Births into the population, mu * N
S -> death, Natural mortality (Susceptible), mu * S
E -> death, Natural mortality (Exposed), mu * E
I -> death, Natural mortality (Infectious), (mu + alpha) * I
R -> death, Natural mortality (Recovered), mu * R

Table of Parameters & Values
Parameter, Meaning, Value
beta, Contact transmission rate, 0.21
sigma, Latency rate (1/incubation period), 0.143
gamma, Recovery rate (1/infectious period), 0.0714
omega, Rate of immunity loss (1/immunity duration), 0.00274
mu, Background birth/death rate (1/life expectancy), 0.000036
alpha, Infection-induced mortality rate, 0.0
N, Total Population (dynamic calculation), S + E + I + R (always equals 1.0 for normalized model)

Initial Populations
S(0) = 0.999
E(0) = 0.001
I(0) = 0.0
R(0) = 0.0
malariaModel:
Table of Compartments
Index, Primary Name, Secondary Name, Description
0, Susceptible Humans population, -, Humans susceptible to malaria
1, Exposed Humans Population, -, Humans infected but not yet infectious
2, Infected Humans Population, -, Infectious humans
3, Recovered Humans Population, -, Recovered humans with partial immunity
4, Susceptible Mosquitoes Population, -, Mosquitoes susceptible to infection
5, Exposed Mosquitoes Population, -, Infected mosquitoes (latent)
6, Infected Mosquitoes Population, -, Infectious mosquitoes

Table of Flows
From -> To, Flow Type, Description, Parameter / Expression
SH -> EH, ContactFlow, Human infection from infected mosquitoes, β₁a(T)
EH -> IH, RateFlow, Progression of exposed humans to infected, ρₕ
IH -> RH, RateFlow, Human recovery, γₕ
RH -> SH, RateFlow, Loss of immunity, q
SM -> EM, ContactFlow, Mosquito infection from infected humans, β₂a(T)
EM -> IM, RateFlow, Progression of exposed mosquitoes to infected, Λₘ(T)
∅ -> SH, BirthSource, Human recruitment, αₕ
∅ -> SM, BirthSource, Mosquito recruitment, θᵥ(T,R)
SH -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of susceptible humans, μₕ
EH -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of exposed humans, μₕ
IH -> ∅, DeathSink, Disease-induced death in humans, μₕ+δ
RH -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of recovered humans, μₕ
SM -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of susceptible mosquitoes, μᵥ(T)
EM -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of exposed mosquitoes, μᵥ(T)
IM -> ∅, DeathSink, Natural death of infected mosquitoes, μᵥ(T)

Table of Parameter Values
Parameter, Meaning, Value / Expression, Unit
αₕ, Human recruitment rate, 15129, people/time
β₂a(T), Combined mosquito contact rate, β₂ * a(T), 1/time
β₁a(T), Combined human contact rate, β₁ * a(T), 1/time
q, Rate of loss of immunity (Rh to Sh), 0.98765, 1/time
β₁, Transmission probability human, 0.9969, dimensionless
μₕ, Natural human mortality rate, 0.001384, 1/time
a(T), Mosquito biting rate, 0.000203*T*(T-11.7)*sqrt(42.3-T), bites/person/time
μᵥ(T), Mosquito mortality rate, 1/((-0.03*T*T)+(1.31*T)-4.4), 1/time
ρₕ, Human incubation progression, 0.001995, 1/time
γₕ, Human recovery rate, 0.120342, 1/time
μₕ+δ, Disease-induced mortality, μₕ + 0.017325, 1/time
θᵥ(T,R), Mosquito recruitment rate, (200 * exp(-0.00554*T + 0.06737) * 4 * R * (50 - R) * 6.75e-5) / (2 + (1 / (0.00554*T - 0.056737))) * (1 - Nᵥ/K) * Nᵥ, mosquitoes/time
Nᵥ, Mosquito population (dynamic), SM + EM + IM (recalculated each timestep), mosquitoes
Nₕ, Human population (dynamic), SH + EH + IH + RH (recalculated each timestep for force of infection denominators), humans
β₂, Transmission probability mosquito, 0.9917, dimensionless
Λₘ(T), Mosquito incubation progression, 1/(exp(μᵥ(T)) * (111/(T - 16))), 1/time
K, Mosquito carrying capacity, 100000, mosquitoes
T, Temperature (independent variable), (variable - provided at simulation time), °C
R, Rainfall (independent variable), (variable - provided at simulation time), mm

Independent Variables
Variable, Type, Description
T, Independent variable, Temperature in degrees Celsius. Used in a(T), μᵥ(T), Λₘ(T), θᵥ(T,R). Must be provided at simulation time.
R, Independent variable, Rainfall in millimeters. Used in θᵥ(T,R). Must be provided at simulation time.

Dynamic Population Calculations
Variable, Formula, Description
Nᵥ, SM + EM + IM, Total mosquito population. Recalculated dynamically at each timestep for use in θᵥ(T,R).
Nₕ, SH + EH + IH + RH, Total human population. Recalculated dynamically at each timestep for force of infection denominators in ContactFlows.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR MODEL GENERATION:
1. This is a PDE (Partial Differential Equation) model with independent variables T (temperature) and R (rainfall)
2. T and R are NOT constants - they are independent variables that must be provided at simulation time
3. Many parameters (a(T), μᵥ(T), Λₘ(T), θᵥ(T,R)) are temperature and/or rainfall dependent
4. Nᵥ (total mosquito population) is DYNAMIC: SM + EM + IM, recalculated at each timestep
5. Nₕ (total human population) is DYNAMIC: SH + EH + IH + RH, recalculated at each timestep
6. The θᵥ(T,R) formula includes Nᵥ which makes it density-dependent (logistic growth)
7. Initial populations are NOT provided - must be specified by the user at simulation setup
8. ContactFlows use dynamic population denominators (Nₕ for human infections, Nₕ for mosquito infections)
9. All temperature-dependent rates must be recalculated when T changes
10. All rainfall-dependent rates must be recalculated when R changes
smartHIVInput:
HIV/AIDS MODEL WITH SEXUAL BEHAVIOR STRATIFICATION 
 MODEL TYPE: Parametric (use named parameters with Greek symbols) 
 COMPARTMENTS: 
 Create 4 base compartments, each stratified by SexualBehavior group: 
 - Susceptible (no secondary name) 
 - Infectious, Untreated (secondary name: "Untreated") 
 - Treated, with ART (secondary name: "with ART") 
 - Infectious, living with AIDS (secondary name: "living with AIDS") 
 STRATIFICATION: 
 Group name: SexualBehavior 
 Group values: Homosexual Men, Women, Heterosexual Men 
 Product name: SexualBehaviorProduct 
 Product description: Stratification by sexual behavior 
 All 4 compartments use this product for stratification. 
 INITIAL POPULATIONS: 
 Susceptible: Homosexual Men=2446, Women=189994, Heterosexual Men=171173 
 Infectious (Untreated): Homosexual Men=79, Women=6, Heterosexual Men=29 
 Treated: 107 total (no stratification for initial value) 
 Infectious (AIDS): 47 total (no stratification for initial value) 
 PARAMETERS: 
 Create these parameters in order with exact names, expressions, descriptions, and units: 
 Ψ | CONSTANT | 333 | Recruitment rate into susceptible population | individuals/year 
 θ | CONSTANT | 0.48 | Proportion of men in population | dimensionless 
 γ | CONSTANT | 0.92 | Proportion of heterosexual men among all men | dimensionless 
 p | CONSTANT | 0.90 | Proportion of infected receiving initial treatment | dimensionless 
 μ | CONSTANT | 0.0129 | Natural mortality rate | 1/year 
 d | CONSTANT | 0.3333 | AIDS-induced mortality rate | 1/year 
 δ | CONSTANT | 0.018 | AIDS development rate in treated individuals | 1/year 
 α | CONSTANT | 0.3333 | Departure rate from infected compartments | 1/year 
 β_h | CONSTANT | 0.44 | Probability of homosexual transmission | dimensionless 
 β_s | CONSTANT | 0.02 | Probability of heterosexual transmission | dimensionless 
 β_hw | CONSTANT | 0.018 | Probability of transmission homosexual men to women | dimensionless 
 β_hm | CONSTANT | 0.25 | Probability of transmission homosexual men to heterosexual men | dimensionless 
 c_h | CONSTANT | 7 | Sexual partners rate for homosexuals | 1/year 
 c_s | CONSTANT | 4 | Sexual partners rate for heterosexuals | 1/year 
 c_hw | CONSTANT | 2 | Sexual partners rate homosexual men and women | 1/year 
 c_hm | CONSTANT | 1 | Sexual partners rate homosexual and heterosexual men | 1/year 
 B_h | EXPRESSION | β_h * c_h | Combined transmission rate homosexuals | 1/year 
 B_s | EXPRESSION | β_s * c_s | Combined transmission rate heterosexuals | 1/year 
 B_hw | EXPRESSION | β_hw * c_hw | Combined transmission rate homosexual to women | 1/year 
 B_hm | EXPRESSION | β_hm * c_hm | Combined transmission rate homosexual to heterosexual men | 1/year 
 Ψθ(1-γ) | EXPRESSION | Ψ * θ * (1 - γ) | Recruitment rate homosexual men | individuals/year 
 Ψ(1-θ) | EXPRESSION | Ψ * (1 - θ) | Recruitment rate women | individuals/year 
 Ψθγ | EXPRESSION | Ψ * θ * γ | Recruitment rate heterosexual men | individuals/year 
 αp | EXPRESSION | α * p | Treatment initiation rate | 1/year 
 α(1-p) | EXPRESSION | α * (1 - p) | AIDS progression rate untreated | 1/year 
 λ_h | EXPRESSION | B_h * (I_h / (S_h + I_h)) | Force of infection homosexual men | 1/year 
 λ_hw | EXPRESSION | B_hw * (I_h / (S_m + S_h + I_m + I_h)) | Force of infection homosexual to women | 1/year 
 λ_hm | EXPRESSION | B_hm * (I_h / (S_m + S_h + I_m + I_h)) | Force of infection homosexual to heterosexual men | 1/year 
 λ_m | EXPRESSION | B_s * (I_m / (S_m + I_m)) | Force of infection heterosexual men | 1/year 
 λ_w | EXPRESSION | B_s * (I_w / (S_w + I_w)) | Force of infection women | 1/year 
 FLOWS: 
 All flows reference parameters not numeric values. 
 Flow 1: Susceptible to Infectious (Untreated) 
 Type: ContactFlow 
 Source: Susceptible compartment 
 Target: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Description: Infection through sexual contact 
 Contact compartment: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Stratum-specific contact rate parameters: 
   Homosexual Men: use λ_h parameter 
   Women: use λ_m parameter (women infected by heterosexual men Iw) 
   Heterosexual Men: use λ_w parameter (heterosexual men infected by women Im) 
 Note: This represents within-group transmission. 
 Flow 2: Susceptible to Infectious (Untreated) - Cross transmission homosexual to women 
 Type: ContactFlow 
 Source: Susceptible compartment 
 Target: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Description: Cross-infection from homosexual men to women 
 Contact compartment: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Stratum-specific contact rate parameters: 
   Homosexual Men: rate=0 (no flow) 
   Women: use λ_hw parameter 
   Heterosexual Men: rate=0 (no flow) 
 Flow 3: Susceptible to Infectious (Untreated) - Cross transmission homosexual to heterosexual men 
 Type: ContactFlow 
 Source: Susceptible compartment 
 Target: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Description: Cross-infection from homosexual men to heterosexual men 
 Contact compartment: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Stratum-specific contact rate parameters: 
   Homosexual Men: rate=0 (no flow) 
   Women: rate=0 (no flow) 
   Heterosexual Men: use λ_hm parameter 
 Flow 4: Infectious (Untreated) to Treated 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Target: Treated compartment 
 Description: Initial treatment with antiretrovirals 
 Rate parameter: αp (same for all strata) 
 Flow 5: Infectious (Untreated) to Infectious (AIDS) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (Untreated) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (AIDS) compartment 
 Description: Progression to AIDS without treatment 
 Rate parameter: α(1-p) (same for all strata) 
 Flow 6: Treated to Infectious (AIDS) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Treated compartment 
 Target: Infectious (AIDS) compartment 
 Description: Treatment failure progression to AIDS 
 Rate parameter: δ (same for all strata) 
 BIRTH SOURCES: 
 All reference parameters not numeric values. 
 Birth 1: 
 Name: Recruitment of Homosexual Men 
 Rate parameter: Ψθ(1-γ) 
 Target: Susceptible compartment 
 Target stratum: Homosexual Men 
 Birth 2: 
 Name: Recruitment of Women 
 Rate parameter: Ψ(1-θ) 
 Target: Susceptible compartment 
 Target stratum: Women 
 Birth 3: 
 Name: Recruitment of Heterosexual Men 
 Rate parameter: Ψθγ 
 Target: Susceptible compartment 
 Target stratum: Heterosexual Men 
 DEATH SINKS: 
 Natural death from all compartments all strata: 
 For Susceptible compartment: 
   Natural Death from Susceptible (Homosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Susceptible - stratum Homosexual Men 
   Natural Death from Susceptible (Women) - rate parameter μ - source Susceptible - stratum Women 
   Natural Death from Susceptible (Heterosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Susceptible - stratum Heterosexual Men 
 For Infectious Untreated compartment: 
   Natural Death from Untreated Infected (Homosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious Untreated - stratum Homosexual Men 
   Natural Death from Untreated Infected (Women) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious Untreated - stratum Women 
   Natural Death from Untreated Infected (Heterosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious Untreated - stratum Heterosexual Men 
 For Treated compartment: 
   Natural Death from Treated (Homosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Treated - stratum Homosexual Men 
   Natural Death from Treated (Women) - rate parameter μ - source Treated - stratum Women 
   Natural Death from Treated (Heterosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Treated - stratum Heterosexual Men 
 For Infectious AIDS compartment: 
   Natural Death from AIDS (Homosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Homosexual Men 
   Natural Death from AIDS (Women) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Women 
   Natural Death from AIDS (Heterosexual Men) - rate parameter μ - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Heterosexual Men 
 AIDS-induced death from AIDS compartment only: 
   AIDS Death (Homosexual Men) - rate parameter d - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Homosexual Men 
   AIDS Death (Women) - rate parameter d - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Women 
   AIDS Death (Heterosexual Men) - rate parameter d - source Infectious AIDS - stratum Heterosexual Men
smartCovidInput:
COVID-19 MODEL WITH AGE STRATIFICATION 
 MODEL TYPE: Parametric (use named parameters with Greek symbols) 
 COMPARTMENTS: 
 Create 15 base compartments, each stratified by AgeGroup: 
 - Susceptible (no secondary name) 
 - Exposed (no secondary name) 
 - Exposed, quarantined (secondary name: "quarantined") 
 - Infectious, presymptomatic (secondary name: "presymptomatic") 
 - Infectious, presymptomatic isolated (secondary name: "presymptomatic, isolated") 
 - Infectious, mild to moderate (secondary name: "mild to moderate") 
 - Infectious, mild to moderate isolated (secondary name: "mild to moderate, isolated") 
 - Infectious, severe (secondary name: "severe") 
 - Infectious, severe isolated (secondary name: "severe, isolated") 
 - Isolated (no secondary name) 
 - Admitted to hospital (no secondary name) 
 - ICU (no secondary name) 
 - Admitted to hospital, post-ICU (secondary name: "post-ICU") 
 - Recovered (no secondary name) 
 - COVID Deaths (no secondary name) 
 STRATIFICATION: 
 Group name: AgeGroup 
 Group values: 0-17, 18-64, 65+ 
 Product name: AgeStratification 
 Product description: Age-based compartment stratification 
 All 15 compartments use this product for stratification. 
 INITIAL POPULATIONS: 
 Susceptible: 0-17=4900000, 18-64=8800000, 65+=1000000 
 Exposed: 0-17=1667, 18-64=3000, 65+=333 
 Exposed (quarantined): 0-17=333, 18-64=600, 65+=67 
 Infectious (presymptomatic): 0-17=1000, 18-64=1800, 65+=200 
 Infectious (presymptomatic isolated): 0-17=333, 18-64=600, 65+=67 
 Infectious (mild to moderate): 0-17=2667, 18-64=4800, 65+=533 
 Infectious (mild to moderate isolated): 0-17=1333, 18-64=2400, 65+=267 
 Infectious (severe): 0-17=667, 18-64=1200, 65+=133 
 Infectious (severe isolated): 0-17=267, 18-64=480, 65+=53 
 Isolated: 0-17=2000, 18-64=3600, 65+=400 
 Admitted to hospital: 0-17=500, 18-64=900, 65+=100 
 ICU: 0-17=133, 18-64=240, 65+=27 
 Admitted to hospital (post-ICU): 0-17=67, 18-64=120, 65+=13 
 Recovered: 0-17=16667, 18-64=30000, 65+=3333 
 COVID Deaths: 0-17=33, 18-64=60, 65+=7 
 PARAMETERS: 
 Create these parameters in order with exact names, expressions, descriptions, and units: 
 β | CONSTANT | 0.00001 | Base transmission rate | 1/time 
 q | CONSTANT | 0.0 | Quarantine rate for exposed | 1/time 
 σ | CONSTANT | 0.4 | Incubation rate (progression to infectious) | 1/time 
 σ_q | CONSTANT | 0.4 | Incubation rate for quarantined | 1/time 
 γ_p | CONSTANT | 1.0 | Rate of symptom onset | 1/time 
 p_severe | CONSTANT | 0.15 | Probability of developing severe symptoms | dimensionless 
 γ_m | CONSTANT | 0.167 | Recovery rate for mild cases | 1/time 
 α_m | CONSTANT | 0.5 | Isolation rate for mild cases | 1/time 
 γ_s | CONSTANT | 0.167 | Hospitalization rate for severe cases | 1/time 
 α_iso | CONSTANT | 0.0 | Rate of movement to isolated state | 1/time 
 γ_iso | CONSTANT | 0.167 | Recovery rate from isolation | 1/time 
 γ_h_r | CONSTANT | 0.74 | Recovery rate from pre-ICU hospital | 1/time 
 γ_h_icu | CONSTANT | 0.26 | Progression rate to ICU | 1/time 
 γ_icu_post | CONSTANT | 0.6 | Improvement rate ICU to post-ICU | 1/time 
 μ_icu | CONSTANT | 0.4 | Mortality rate in ICU | 1/time 
 γ_post | CONSTANT | 0.048 | Recovery rate post-ICU | 1/time 
 N | CONSTANT | 14800000 | Total population | individuals 
 birth_rate | CONSTANT | 3.0E-5 | Population birth rate | 1/time 
 (1-q) | EXPRESSION | (1 - q) | Non-quarantine rate | dimensionless 
 (1-p_severe) | EXPRESSION | (1 - p_severe) | Probability of mild symptoms | dimensionless 
 (1-q)*σ | EXPRESSION | (1 - q) * σ | Non-quarantine incubation rate | 1/time 
 γ_p*(1-p_severe) | EXPRESSION | γ_p * (1 - p_severe) | Mild symptom development rate | 1/time 
 γ_p*p_severe | EXPRESSION | γ_p * p_severe | Severe symptom development rate | 1/time 
 FLOWS: 
 All flows reference parameters not numeric values. 
 Flow 1: Susceptible to Exposed 
 Type: ContactFlow 
 Source: Susceptible compartment 
 Target: Exposed compartment 
 Description: Infection through contact with infectious individuals 
 Contact compartment: Infectious (presymptomatic) compartment 
 Contact rate parameter: β 
 Stratum-specific contact rates: 
   0-17: use β parameter multiplied by 0.7 (children lower susceptibility) 
   18-64: use β parameter multiplied by 1.0 (standard susceptibility) 
   65+: use β parameter multiplied by 1.3 (elderly higher susceptibility) 
 Note: This simplifies the multi-compartment transmission from original model. Contact with presymptomatic represents overall infectious contact. 
 Flow 2: Exposed to Exposed (quarantined) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Exposed compartment 
 Target: Exposed (quarantined) compartment 
 Description: Quarantine of exposed individuals 
 Rate parameter: q 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 3: Exposed to Infectious (presymptomatic) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Exposed compartment 
 Target: Infectious (presymptomatic) compartment 
 Description: Progression to presymptomatic infectious 
 Rate parameter: (1-q)*σ 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use (1-q)*σ parameter multiplied by 1.25 (faster progression) 
   18-64: use (1-q)*σ parameter multiplied by 1.0 (standard progression) 
   65+: use (1-q)*σ parameter multiplied by 0.75 (slower progression) 
 Flow 4: Exposed (quarantined) to Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Exposed (quarantined) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) compartment 
 Description: Progression of quarantined to isolated presymptomatic 
 Rate parameter: σ_q 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use σ_q parameter multiplied by 1.25 
   18-64: use σ_q parameter multiplied by 1.0 
   65+: use σ_q parameter multiplied by 0.75 
 Flow 5: Infectious (presymptomatic) to Infectious (mild to moderate) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (presymptomatic) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (mild to moderate) compartment 
 Description: Development of mild to moderate symptoms 
 Rate parameter: γ_p*(1-p_severe) 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 1.15 (99% mild for children) 
   18-64: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 1.0 (85% mild for adults) 
   65+: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 0.76 (65% mild for elderly) 
 Flow 6: Infectious (presymptomatic) to Infectious (severe) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (presymptomatic) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (severe) compartment 
 Description: Development of severe symptoms 
 Rate parameter: γ_p*p_severe 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 0.07 (1% severe for children) 
   18-64: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 1.0 (15% severe for adults) 
   65+: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 2.33 (35% severe for elderly) 
 Flow 7: Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) to Infectious (mild to moderate isolated) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (mild to moderate isolated) compartment 
 Description: Development of mild symptoms in isolated 
 Rate parameter: γ_p*(1-p_severe) 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 1.15 
   18-64: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 1.0 
   65+: use γ_p*(1-p_severe) parameter multiplied by 0.76 
 Flow 8: Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) to Infectious (severe isolated) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (presymptomatic isolated) compartment 
 Target: Infectious (severe isolated) compartment 
 Description: Development of severe symptoms in isolated 
 Rate parameter: γ_p*p_severe 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 0.07 
   18-64: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 1.0 
   65+: use γ_p*p_severe parameter multiplied by 2.33 
 Flow 9: Infectious (mild to moderate) to Isolated 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (mild to moderate) compartment 
 Target: Isolated compartment 
 Description: Detection and isolation of mild cases 
 Rate parameter: α_m 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 10: Infectious (mild to moderate) to Recovered 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (mild to moderate) compartment 
 Target: Recovered compartment 
 Description: Recovery from mild symptoms without isolation 
 Rate parameter: γ_m 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 11: Infectious (mild to moderate isolated) to Isolated 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (mild to moderate isolated) compartment 
 Target: Isolated compartment 
 Description: Transfer to central isolation facility 
 Rate parameter: α_iso 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 12: Infectious (severe) to Admitted to hospital 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (severe) compartment 
 Target: Admitted to hospital compartment 
 Description: Hospitalization of severe cases 
 Rate parameter: γ_s 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 13: Infectious (severe isolated) to Admitted to hospital 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Infectious (severe isolated) compartment 
 Target: Admitted to hospital compartment 
 Description: Hospitalization of isolated severe cases 
 Rate parameter: γ_s 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 14: Isolated to Recovered 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Isolated compartment 
 Target: Recovered compartment 
 Description: Recovery from isolation 
 Rate parameter: γ_iso 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 Flow 15: Admitted to hospital to Recovered 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Admitted to hospital compartment 
 Target: Recovered compartment 
 Description: Recovery from hospital (pre-ICU) 
 Rate parameter: γ_h_r 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_h_r parameter multiplied by 1.22 (90% recovery for children) 
   18-64: use γ_h_r parameter multiplied by 1.08 (80% recovery for adults) 
   65+: use γ_h_r parameter multiplied by 0.81 (60% recovery for elderly) 
 Flow 16: Admitted to hospital to ICU 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Admitted to hospital compartment 
 Target: ICU compartment 
 Description: Admission to ICU 
 Rate parameter: γ_h_icu 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata (26% for all ages) 
 Flow 17: ICU to Admitted to hospital (post-ICU) 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: ICU compartment 
 Target: Admitted to hospital (post-ICU) compartment 
 Description: Improvement and transfer to post-ICU care 
 Rate parameter: γ_icu_post 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use γ_icu_post parameter multiplied by 1.42 (85% improvement for children) 
   18-64: use γ_icu_post parameter multiplied by 1.17 (70% improvement for adults) 
   65+: use γ_icu_post parameter multiplied by 0.75 (45% improvement for elderly) 
 Flow 18: ICU to COVID Deaths 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: ICU compartment 
 Target: COVID Deaths compartment 
 Description: Death from COVID-19 in ICU 
 Rate parameter: μ_icu 
 Stratum-specific rates: 
   0-17: use μ_icu parameter multiplied by 0.0 (0% mortality for children) 
   18-64: use μ_icu parameter multiplied by 0.5 (20% mortality for adults) 
   65+: use μ_icu parameter multiplied by 1.45 (58% mortality for elderly) 
 Flow 19: Admitted to hospital (post-ICU) to Recovered 
 Type: RateFlow 
 Source: Admitted to hospital (post-ICU) compartment 
 Target: Recovered compartment 
 Description: Recovery from post-ICU hospital care 
 Rate parameter: γ_post 
 Stratum-specific: Same rate for all strata 
 BIRTH SOURCES: 
 Birth 1: 
 Name: Population Birth 
 Rate parameter: birth_rate 
 Target: Susceptible compartment 
 Target stratum: 0-17 
 DEATH SINKS: 
 No natural death sinks modeled. Only COVID deaths occur through Flow 18 (ICU to COVID Deaths compartment).
